prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Next, move on to creating the 2D sketch. The sketch is drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch has one face (face\\_1) and one loop (loop\\_1), containing four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4). * line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.1167, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.1167, 0.0], End Point [0.1167, 0.0167] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.1167, 0.0167], End Point [0.0, 0.0167] * line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0167], End Point [0.0, 0.0] After completing the 2D sketch, proceed to scale it using a scaling parameter of 0.1167. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Set extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal to 0.75, extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal to 0.0, and sketch\\_scale to 0.1167. The boolean operation for this part is the creation of a new solid body. The resulting prism has the following dimensions: * Length: 0.1167 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.1167 The final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, with sides parallel and top and bottom faces perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height, and it is centered in the image.</description>
